title.text: An integrated tool for annotating historical corpora

abstractContent.text: E-Dictor is a tool for encoding, applying levels of editions, and assigning part-of-speech tags to ancient texts.
In short, it works as a WYSIWYG interface to encode text in XML format.
It comes from the experience during the building of the Tycho Brahe Parsed Corpus of Historical Portuguese and from consortium activities with other research groups.

entities.text: Tycho Brahe Parsed Corpus of Historical Portuguese

abstractContent.text: Preliminary results show a decrease of at least 50% on the overall time taken on the editing process .

introductionContent.text: The Tycho Brahe Parsed Corpus of Historical Portuguese (CTB) consists of Portuguese texts written by authors born between 1380 and 1845.

introductionContent.text: Been one of the forefront works among projects dedicated to investigate the history of Portuguese language, it contributed to the renovation of the theoretical relevance of studies about the linguistic change in different frameworks.

This resulted in crescent work with ancient texts in the country (, and, by the end of the 1990s, the work on Corpus Linguistics has given rise to a confluence between philology and computer science, a relationship not so ease to equate.
